    • Method Detail

      • buy

        public static boolean buy(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                          WauzShopItem itemToBuy,
                          WauzShopDiscount discount)
        Tries to buy the given item for the player. Unlike ammo items (arrows), physical items, can only be bought when there is inventory space left. Items cannot be bought, if the player doesn't have enough money.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who wants to buy the item.
        itemToBuy - The item that should be bought.
        discount - The discount on the price of the item.
        Returns:
        If the buying was successful.
        See Also:
        WauzCurrency.getCurrencyAmount(Player), ItemUtils.fitsInInventory(Inventory, ItemStack), ItemUtils.isAmmoItem(ItemStack), PlayerConfigurator.setArrowAmount(Player, String, int)

      • sell

        public static boolean sell(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                           org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itemToSell,
                           boolean fromShop)
        Tries to sell the given item for the player. The item stack will either be sold for a random value per item or with bonus on attack / defense. Some items have a fixed sell value in lore, while bought items are worth nothing. TODO: Also refactor this, when implementing equipment builder.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who wants to sell the item.
        itemToSell - The item that should be sold.
        fromShop - If the selling was triggered from a shop menu.
        Returns:
        If the selling was successful.
        See Also:
        PlayerConfigurator.setCharacterCoins(Player, long), PlayerPassiveSkillConfigurator.getTradingFloat(Player), AchievementTracker.addProgress(Player, WauzAchievementType, double)

      • repair

        public static boolean repair(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                             org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itemToRepair,
                             boolean fromShop)
        Tries to repair the given item for the player. Cannot repair items with no or max durability value. If the item is repaired in a shop menu, it will have a cost, equal to the lost durability.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who wants to repair the item.
        itemToRepair - The item that should be repaired.
        fromShop - If the repairing was triggered from a shop menu.
        Returns:
        If the repairing was successful.
        See Also:
        EquipmentUtils.getCurrentDurability(ItemStack), EquipmentUtils.getMaximumDurability(ItemStack), PlayerConfigurator.setCharacterCoins(Player, long), DurabilityCalculator.repairItem(Player, ItemStack)
